body: Antam gold extends its 2026 surge as global volatility rises, with analysts warning sharp swings could delay a new record high.

title: FTSE Russell Delays Indonesia’s March Index Review
body: FTSE Russell has postponed Indonesia’s March 2026 index review, citing technical uncertainty in ongoing market reforms.

title: Stocks Steady Near 8,031 Amid Accelerated Capital Market Reforms
body: JCI stayed near 8,031 as investors tracked market reforms, stronger consumer confidence, and mixed global sentiment.

title: Dana Syariah CEO Seeks Settlement After Thousands Lose Rp 1.4 Trillion
body: Dana Syariah CEO seeks restorative justice after Rp 1.4 trillion in lender funds went unpaid, pledging full repayment amid a police probe.

title: IDX Tightens Disclosure Rules, Lowers Shareholder Reporting Threshold to 1%
body: The IDX now requires shareholders owning 1% or more to disclose their data, a reform aimed at boosting transparency and investor trust.

title: Indonesia Consumer Sentiment Improves as Growth Holds Above 5%
body: The Consumer Confidence Index (CCI) climbed to 127 in January from 123.5 in December, keeping the gauge firmly in optimistic territory.

title: Minimum 15% Free Float May Come With 2–3 Year Transition: IDX
body: Indonesia’s 15% free float rule will require a 2–3 year transition as regulators guide 267 issuers toward gradual compliance.

title: IDX, Regulators Enter Technical Discussions With MSCI on Market Integrity
body: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) is set to hold a follow-up technical meeting with MSCI Inc. this week.

title: American Firms See Vietnam, Indonesia, Philippines as SE Asia’s 'VIP Club'
body: Vietnam is leading the club because of its advanced trade policy and human capital investment, US-ASEAN Business Council says.

title: ‘Why Should I?’ Purbaya Jokes as Thomas Begins Term at Bank Indonesia
body: Finance Minister Purbaya congratulated Thomas Djiwandono on his BI appointment, joking he was “smarter,” and urged policy synergy.

title: Rupiah Gains 71 Points on Easing US–Iran Tensions and Data Outlook
body: Rupiah closed at Rp 16,805 per dollar on Monday, up 71 points as easing US–Iran tensions and key global data guided sentiment.

title: Indonesia Seeks to Calm Investor Nerves After Moody’s Warning
body: Indonesia says strong fundamentals, downstreaming, and licensing reforms will sustain investor confidence despite a recent outlook downgrade

title: JCI Rises 1.22% to End Above 8,000 as Global Optimism Lifts Markets
body: JCI closed above 8,000 after rebounding on easing tensions, stronger China data and resilient consumer confidence.

title: Prabowo’s Nephew Thomas Djiwandono Sworn in as Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor
body: Thomas Djiwandono was sworn in as Bank Indonesia deputy governor for 2026–2031, replacing Juda Agung after a presidential decree.

title: Downstream Industrialization Contributes 30% of 2025 Investment, Expansion Planned
body: Indonesia plans to expand downstream industrialization beyond natural resources, streamline licensing and strengthen trust for growth.

title: Jakarta Stocks Edge Up Early While Moody’s Warning Clouds Banking Outlook
body: JCI opened higher Monday as investors weighed Moody’s negative bank outlook, persistent volatility, and a rebound across Wall Street.

title: Don’t Be Scared of US Sanctions, Iran Tells Indonesia
body: Iranian Ambassador to Indonesia Mohammad Boroujerdi says the US is "not the king of the world".

title: Jakarta’s 2025 GDP Growth Hits 5.21% on Strong Consumption and Tourism
body: Jakarta’s economy grew 5.21% in 2025, beating the national average as consumption, tourism, and fiscal incentives fueled growth.

title: JCI Extends Losses as MSCI Scrutiny and Moody’s Outlook Weigh on Market
body: JCI slid nearly 5% for the week as MSCI scrutiny and Moody’s negative outlook rattled sentiment and cut trading activity.

title: Indonesian Consumers Buy 48 Tons of Gold in 2025 Despite Record Prices
body: Indonesia’s gold demand grew in 2025 as consumers increasingly bought gold for investment despite record-high prices, the World Gold Council
